New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 5 月 9 日星期四 18:13:53 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Grid crisis: Power cuts possible as cold weather sees demand spike, Transpower issues warning https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/power-cuts-possible-amid-grid-crisis-cold-weather-sees-demand-outstrip-supply-transpower-issues-warning/XLJOJZ34ZZDO3MZNWK77DUWKVA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/power-cuts-possible-amid-grid-crisis-cold-weather-sees-demand-outstrip-supply-transpower-issues-warning/XLJOJZ34ZZDO3MZNWK77DUWKVA/ Raphael FranksThe country’s grid operator issued a warning notice in advance.Thu, 09 May 2024 18:02:45 +0000 The country’s grid operator Transpower issued a warning notice in advance, saying it did not have enough generation offers to meet demand between 7am and 9am Friday.
Gillian Millane, mother of murdered backpacker Grace, appointed OBE for charitable work following daughter’s death https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gillian-millane-mother-of-murdered-backpacker-grace-appointed-obe-for-charitable-work-following-daughters-death/LXRBCHXPN5HQLAUFXGYZYHGQFY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gillian-millane-mother-of-murdered-backpacker-grace-appointed-obe-for-charitable-work-following-daughters-death/LXRBCHXPN5HQLAUFXGYZYHGQFY/ Benjamin PlummerGillian Millane and her niece were appointed OBEs for their charity work. Thu, 09 May 2024 18:00:16 +0000 Gillian Millane (right), mother of murdered British tourist Grace Millane, and Grace's cousin Hannah O'Callaghan, outside 10 Downing Street in August 2022.

Ngāti Porou East Coast men’s club rugby: Revolving door at top of table after three rounds https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/10/revolving-door-at-top-of-east-coast-club-rugby-table/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/05/10/revolving-door-at-top-of-east-coast-club-rugby-table/ Chris TaewaTVC are the new leaders after their hard-fought win over Hikurangi. The NPEC centurion scored the winning try in his TVC side's 18-15 defeat of Hikurangi in East Coast club rugby last weekend. Photo / Paul Rickard
Mayor Wayne Brown unhappy with Auckland councillors’ repeated ‘personal trips’ to Taiwan, funded by Taiwanese Government https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mayor-wayne-brown-unhappy-with-auckland-councillors-repeated-personal-trips-to-taiwan-funded-by-taiwanese-government/GFJJAEHUGBGRBEPXWA5MIFLE2M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mayor-wayne-brown-unhappy-with-auckland-councillors-repeated-personal-trips-to-taiwan-funded-by-taiwanese-government/GFJJAEHUGBGRBEPXWA5MIFLE2M/ Tom DillaneThe "personal study trips" were funded by the Taiwanese Govt and weren't official. Thu, 09 May 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Auckland Mayor Wayne Brown has expressed concern over Wayne Walker, John Watson and Greg Sayers' trips to Taiwan.
